title: Catriona Matthew on track to be reappointed Europe captain after Solheim Cup triumph
text:
Catriona Matthew looks set to be rewarded for her inspirational leadership at last month’s Solheim Cup by being reappointed as Europe captain for the next match in Toledo.

The Scot was hailed as a huge success by players and experts alike when overcoming the odds against a strong American team at Gleneagles.

In the wake of that gripping one-point triumph, Dame Laura Davies, who acted as one of Matthew’s assistants during the competition, called for the 50-year-old to be reinstated as the blue-and-gold brigade looks for what would be just second victory since the inaugural biennial dust-up in 1990.

And despite the merits of Suzann Pettersen - the Norwegian who retired from competitive action immediately grasping the winning point in Perthshire, it seems the board of the Ladies European Tour is ready to give Matthew the chance to become the first European ever to oversee back-to-back victories.

A press conference is due to be hosted at Gleneagles on Nov 14 to announce the captain for the 2021 showdown at the famous Inverness Club in Ohio.
